revised_title: Molecular Analysis and Classification of Human Prion Diseases
tldr: The authors classify prion diseases into plaque type and non-plaque type based on the distribution of the prion protein in the central nervous system. They report that different genetic variants of the prion protein gene correspond to distinct clinical and pathological features of prion diseases. The distribution of deposits in the central nervous system influences the clinical and pathological aspects of prion diseases, suggesting that accumulations may play a central role in their pathogenesis.
